titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Argimiro Bosch Letters
titlestmt.author: compiled by Jana Lee Krentz

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 11:45
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.Describing Archives: A Content Standard

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: Thirty-one letters written by Argimiro Bosch, a Republican soldier in the Spanish Civil War, to his wife, Angelita Talens Bo, and his family. The letters document Bosch's time as a prisoner in Valencia.

langmaterial.language: The material is in Spanish and Castilian.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the Librarian for the Latin American and Iberian Collections, 2017. Purchased by the Librarian for the Latin American and Iberian Collections from Kevin Jackson, History Revealed, 2016.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The material is arranged as received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Argimiro Bosch was Republican soldier in the Spanish Civil War, during which he was held as a prisoner in Valencia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Thirty-one letters written by Argimiro Bosch, a Republican soldier in the Spanish Civil War, to his wife, Angelita Talens Bo, and his family. The letters document Bosch's time as a prisoner in Valencia.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.
